required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup
clinical_study.official_title: Prospective, Multi-centric, Comparative, Long-term Clinical Follow-Up Study for the Evidence of Safety and Performance Indicators of the Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this observational study is to collect clinical and radiological results of the new Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup in a standard patient population and when used in routine clinical practice.

primary_outcome.measure: Harris Hip Score (Functional results of the operated hip) over time
primary_outcome.description: The functional results of the operated hip will be assessed with the Harris Hip Score (HHS) and evaluated over time

secondary_outcome.description: Any removal or exchange of the acetabular cup or the polyethylene inlay is defined as revision. A removal of the stem is not evaluated as acetabular revision but will be documented and evaluated as part of postoperative complications. The revision-free survival will be assessed using the Kaplan-Meier method.

EQ-5D is a descriptive system of health-related quality of life states consisting of 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, anxiety/depression), each of which can take one of three responses reflecting severity (no problems/some or moderate problems/extreme problems).

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological Assessment: Osseointegration of the cup over time
secondary_outcome.description: The acetabular component in AP view is divided into the three regions I-III as defined by DeLee-Charnley. All three regions will be assessed for osteolysis the implant, to allow an estimation of the osseous integration and stability of the implant.

secondary_outcome.measure: Radiological assessment: Radiographic loosening of the cup over time
secondary_outcome.description: The acetabular component in AP view is divided into the three regions I-III as defined by DeLee-Charnley. All three regions will be assessed for and radiolucent lines around the implant, to allow an estimation of the osseous integration and stability of the implant.
Technical problems with instruments, implants or containers, instrument related issues
The incidence of impingement during intraoperative mobilization is documented;
Complaints or problems with the handling of instruments, implants or containers, instrument related issues
All complications in the postoperative course are recorded

arm_group.description: Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup

intervention.description: Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup

study_pop.textblock:
Patients having acute disorders of the hip, requiring primary or revision surgery, which cannot be treated by other therapies:
- Degenerative osteoarthritis
- Rheumatic arthritis
- Fractures of the joint
- Femoral head necrosis
- Revision surgery where a sufficient intraoperative press-fit can be achieved

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Indication for the cementless Plasmafit® Revision Structan® Hip Endoprosthesis Cup (primary and revision cases, with bone conditions typically demanding a press-fit revision cup)
- Written informed consent
- Cases where a press-fit cup fixation is possible
Exclusion Criteria
- Patients < 18 years
- Pregnant patients
- Patients not able to comply with the study demands, i.e. follow-up visits (mentally or physically)
- Patient has an infection in the hip joint region
